China recently
harvested its second crop of vegetables in
its space garden. This is research that aims to
lay the foundation for
large-scale space farming in the
future. Space gardens have a modular and
structured structure.  Opened by researchers at the
Chinese Astronaut Research and Training Center designed an
easily operated garden farming device that
allows the temperature, humidity,
oxygen and carbon dioxide levels to be adjusted to create an environment.
optimal environment for plant growth
while astronauts have the
flexibility to care for plants at
any time introduced in the
Shenzhou Mission 16 space gardens
placed upside down  In the
space station, plants grown in the device
are also watered in the opposite direction to those
on Earth. The garden is a
second, newly designed recycling device that provides
water and nutrients directly to
plant roots without the need for chemicals.  The platform's notable feature
is its ability to support
successive high-yield growing cycles
to create the foundation for
large-scale growing in space.
